result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy G Sandlin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DISMISS Repeater Enhancer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy G Sandlin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy G Sandlin in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF276 & 14CF423.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 2 of 14CF423 and no contest to Ct. 2 of 14CF276.   Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Case 14CF276  Ct. 2.  60 days jail with huber.  $443.00 costs.  Dismiss repeater enhancer.  Jail credit 51 days.  Any bond on hand to be applied towards costs.  Case 14CF423  Ct. 2  30 days jail with huber.  Consecutive to 14CF276.  $443.00 costs.  Dismiss Ct.  1.  Dismiss repeater enhancer on Ct. 2.  20 days jail credit.  Any bond on hand to be applied towards costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

Defendant Timothy G Sandlin in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana stated matter is not resloved.  Reqested a jury trial.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Matter to be set for trial.  Bond remains.
all prior conds. remain the same

Defendant Timothy G Sandlin in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Masana motioned for signature bond. ADA Yaskal objected. Defendant gave statement. Court amended bond to $150 cash bond. All prior conds. remain the same.

Defendant, Timothy G Sandlin, appeared without attorney. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated he spoke to Atty. Masana. Court reset hearing to allow Atty. Masana to be present.
Bail/bond hearing on July 23, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on July 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy G Sandlin in court, in custody with attorney Peter M Masana.  Christine M Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Stands mute.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Atty Masana requesting return date and pretrial date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
and Notice of Witness List filed by Atty. Peter Masana
with felony conds. and no contact with D.D., not go upon property or residence at W8766 Kent Road.

Defendant, Timothy G Sandlin, appeared by video with Atty Mark Lawton, special for public defender office. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $500 cash bond with felony conds. and no contact with D.D., not go upon property or residence at W8766 Kent Road. Time limits not waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
